intro: Angraecum exile, commonly known as the slender star orchid, is a rare and delicate orchid species native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its long, slender stems and small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Angraecum exile is known for its fragrant blooms, which emit a subtle scent to attract specific pollinators. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species in the wild.
